title: One for one is NOT "worth"
body:
Can we PLEASE teach players that you should not be trying to 1v3 (or 1v4 or 1v5) to try to get a pick on the other team. 

Almost whole team last game would individually go in against the other team and die trying to kill one of them that was low health. Point blank, even if you killed ONE of them and die you gave one kill and at least 3 assists for the one kill you got.

Point is, you're feeding the whole enemy team.

replies.body:
unless 1/42342342/424521124321412 person kills a 14213423234/1/432423432 person

which is obviously unrealistic
Money-wise you are certainly right. However, strategically, an assassin going one for one with the enemy ADC late game is good enough already.

I mean, it's debatable depending on the circumstances of the game and which allied champ killed which enemy champ. 

But for the most part I do agree most players shouldnt typically try to do that

Trade support for Carry, your team can generally do something with that. I would say a 1 for 1 works better if you all ready have the most members out. (5v4 or 4v3)

> While not exactly worth. 1 for 1 is pretty good if get flanked with no escape, and that's simply making the best of a bad situation.

While I think the examples of when its NOT worth is obvious, 

A more specific example of a time it is worth could be: An assassin type champ (say talon) on your team going in and trading his life for a kill at early or mid game. (the gold he gets will be more beneficial since hes an assassin at this point in the game.)

A second example: Their team is setting up for baron, one member jump in and assassinates their ADC/jungler for his life -- this very likely would stop them from baroning since they would be lacking the DPS or smite

These are just two examples of a few where it could be beneficial

In most scenarios yeah. But if it's mid/early game, and your jungler is around to take the turret after the 1 for 1, then that's definitely worth. Going 1 for 1 for a shutdown is also worth it. Killing the enemy adc late game in a 1 for 1 is worth if you're an assassin.

That depends on how much gold the other person is worth vs how much you are worth as well as what your teams do after the death. 

Generally though you are correct.
